content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace at Position(x=0.0, y=0.0) configured with burner‐inserters and output chests.
• Stone Furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=0.0) with a similar configuration.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
Consists of:
• Burner‐mining drill connected to a wooden chest and interlinked by transport belts for iron ore extraction.

### Automation Research Lab
Consists of:
• Laboratory receiving automation‐science‐pack inputs, supported by a network of small electric poles.

### Water Supply System for Power Generation with Updated Steam Engine Placement
Consists of:
• Boiler at Position(x=8.0, y=20.5) with connection points at Position(x=8.5, y=18.5) and Position(x=8.5, y=22.5).
• Offshore Pump at Position(x=0.5, y=30.5).
• Steam Engines:
  – Pre‐existing steam engines at Position(x=1.5, y=13.5), Position(x=13.5, y=14.5), Position(x=19.5, y=14.5), Position(x=13.5, y=17.5), Position(x=17.5, y=20.5), Position(x=11.5, y=20.5), Position(x=22.5, y=18.5) and Position(x=4.5, y=23.5) (the latter currently unconnected).
  – Extra Steam Engine for Improved Integration:
   • Initial placement attempts at Position(x=8.5, y=17.5) and Position(x=14.5, y=17.5) resulted in pipe connection errors.
   • Successfully placed at Position(x=0.5, y=9.5) (Step 432) but pipe connection to the Boiler failed.
   • Subsequent repositioning toward the desired center at Position(x=8.5, y=18.5) was aborted due to unbuildable candidate areas.
   • Current status: The extra steam engine remains at Position(x=0.5, y=9.5) without proper integration.

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Identifier and Naming Errors
 – Ensure all variables are correctly defined to avoid NameError (e.g. the undefined identifier “to”).

• Pipe Connection Issues
 – Verify that connection points of both the Boiler (at Position(x=8.0, y=20.5)) and the steam engine are aligned and unobstructed.
 – Confirm an adequate pipe supply and clear the intended connection path before initiating the operation.

• Placement and Repositioning Errors
 – Confirm that target positions for steam engine placement are free, buildable, and within allowed distance.
 – Remove or reposition interfering entities manually before attempting placement in congested areas.

• Buildable Area Search Failures
 – If a valid buildable position is not found in the local or extended search (e.g. near Position(x=8.5, y=18.5)), consider manually clearing obstructions or selecting an alternate area.

• Attribute Access Errors
 – When processing various entity types (such as PipeGroup objects that lack a “warnings” attribute), use proper attribute checks or error handling to prevent AttributeError.

• Diagnostic and Congestion Issues
 – Recognize that a clustered area of power‐generation entities (steam engines, Boiler, pipe groups) can block new placement.
 – Prior to integration of an extra steam engine, clear space by repositioning or removing non‐essential obstructing entities (for example, via pickup_entity) and then re‐attempt placement.
